name: Stomach Pain
description: Stomach pain refers to discomfort in the abdominal area. It may be caused by indigestion, gas, mild infection, or dietary issues. Most mild cases improve with rest and proper hydration.

mild.definition: Mild abdominal discomfort with short duration

high_risk.definition: Severe abdominal pain or pain with danger signs

criteria.other_symptoms: persistent vomiting, black stools, severe dehydration

self_care: Drink plenty of fluids including ORS if needed
Apply a warm compress to the abdomen
Eat light and easily digestible food

medicines.name: Dicycloverine 10mg Tablet

medicines.name: Omeprazole 20mg Capsule
medicines.used_for: Stomach pain due to acidity or gastritis
medicines.dose: Adults: 20 mg once daily before meals

doctor_consultation.message: Seek medical attention if stomach pain is severe, persistent, or associated with black stools, vomiting blood, or severe dehydration.

assessment_questions.question: How severe is your stomach pain?
How many days have you had this pain?

disclaimer: This is educational information only and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Seek urgent care for severe or worsening abdominal pain.
